details.purpose: Zur Dokumentation der Sauerstoffsättigung im Blut unter Benutzung eines Pulsoxymeters.

To record indirect, currently non-invasive, blood gas measurements, such as Spo2 and pTCO2, via pulse oximetry, transcutaneous oximetry or other methods.
It is likely that this archetype will be used primarily to record oxygenation estimations, but other gas measurements may be included, or added over time.
details.use:
Used to record indirect blood gas measurement, currently by non-invasive techniques. New indirect blood gas measurements should be added to this archetype.
Where the recording device also provides another type of measurement, such as pulse rate, this should be recorded in a separate archetype, appropriate for that particular measurement e.g. the OBSERVATION.heart_rate-pulse archetype, to allow consistent querying.
The aim is to consistently model a clinical concept, rather than to model device output ; devices are increasingly multi-functional and provide overlapping measurements which may need to be recorded using a number of discrete archetypes.
Waveforms should be recorded here when used to document quality of the blood gas measurement. In contrast, if used for primary diagnostic purposes e.g. of cardiac output, plesmythography should be recorded in the key associated clinical archetype - OBSERVATION.heart_rate-pulse.
details.misuse:
Any blood gas measurement that involves direct contact with blood, and measuring PaO2, PaCO2 should not be recorded using this archetype - Use OBSERVATION.lab_test-blood_gases archetype. New direct blood gas measurements should be added to OBSERVATION.lab_test-blood_gases.v1.
NOT to be used to record direct blood gas measurement e.g arterial (SaO2), venous (SvO2) oxygen saturation or Oxygen content (CaOC) usually determined by invasive methods e.g. lab blood gases or vascular catheter devices. These should be recorded within the OBSERVATION.lab_test-blood_gases archetype.

translations.author: Jasmin Buck, Sebastian Garde
University of Heidelberg, Central Queensland University

items.items: *Method of monitoring blood gas measurements such as Spo2 and pTCO2 by indirect, currently non-invasive, means.(en)
*Measured via pulse oximetry, the saturation of oxygen in the peripheral blood.(en)
*SpO2 is defined as the ratio of oxyhaemoglobin (HbO2) to the total concentration of haemoglobin (HbO2 + deoxyhaemoglobin).(en)
*Details of the amount of oxygen being delivered to the subject at the time of observation. Assumed values of 21% oxygen concentration, Fi02 of 0.21 and oxygen flow rate of 0 l/min or 0 ml/min.(en)
*Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be affect interpretation of the observation. For example, motion, pain, feeding in infants, tracheostomy.(en)
*Details of the non-invasive oximetry device used.(en)

*Details of a series of oximetry readings, other than waveforms, expressed as a multimedia image or series of images. Waveforms should be recorded using the Waveform slot and associated cluster archetype.(en)
*The type of measurement sensor used e.g. transmittal, reflective, clamp or strip, electrode.(en)
*Details about physical activity undertaken at the time of measurement.(en)
*A text comment about the indirect oximetry result.(en)
*The operating temperature of a transcutaneous oximeter electrode.(en)
*The date and time at which the sensor was applied. Important for transcutaneous oximetry.(en)
*Measured via transcutaneous electrode oximetry, the partial pressure of oxygen in the peripheral blood.(en)
*Measured via transcutaneous electrode oximetry, the partial pressure of carbon dioxide in the peripheral blood.(en)
*Measured via pulse CO-oximetry, the oxygen content of the peripheral blood.(en)
*Measured via pulse CO-oximetry, the saturation of carboxyhaemoglobin in the perpiheral blood.(en)
*Measured via pulse CO-oximetry, the saturation of methoxyhaemoglobin in the peripheral blood.(en)
*A pulse oximetry transmittal sensor was applied.(en)
*A pulse oximetry reflective sensor was applied.(en)
*A pulse oximetry clamp sensor was applied.(en)
*A pulse oximetry strip sensor was applied.(en)
*A waveform reading associated with the oximetry measurement.(en)
Method of monitoring blood gas measurements such as Spo2 and pTCO2 by indirect, currently non-invasive, means.
Measured via pulse oximetry, the saturation of oxygen in the peripheral blood.
SpO2 is defined as the ratio of oxyhaemoglobin (HbO2) to the total concentration of haemoglobin (HbO2 + deoxyhaemoglobin).
The site of the measurement sensor.
Details of the amount of oxygen available to the subject at the time of observation. Assumed values of 21% oxygen concentration, Fi02 of 0.21 and oxygen flow rate of 0 l/min or 0 ml/min.
Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be affect interpretation of the observation. For example, motion, pain, poor perfusion, infant feeding.
Details of the non-invasive oximetry device used.

Details of a series of oximetry readings, other than waveforms, expressed as a multimedia image or series of images. Waveforms should be recorded using the Waveform slot and associated cluster archetype.
The type of measurement sensor used e.g. transmittal, reflective, clamp or strip, electrode.
Details about physical activity undertaken at the time of measurement.
A text comment about the indirect oximetry result.
The operating temperature of a transcutaneous oximeter electrode.
The date and time at which the sensor was applied. Significant for transcutaneous oximetry.
Measured via transcutaneous electrode oximetry, the partial pressure of oxygen in the peripheral blood.
Measured via transcutaneous electrode oximetry, the partial pressure of carbon dioxide in the peripheral blood.
Measured via pulse CO-oximetry, the oxygen content of the peripheral blood.
Measured via pulse CO-oximetry, the saturation of carboxyhaemoglobin in the perpiheral blood.
Measured via pulse CO-oximetry, the saturation of methoxyhaemoglobin in the peripheral blood.
A pulse oximetry transmittal sensor was applied.
A pulse oximetry reflective sensor was applied.
A pulse oximetry clamp sensor was applied.
A pulse oximetry strip sensor was applied.
A transcutaneous electrode sensor was applied.
A waveform reading associated with the oximetry measurement.
